Class TransactionDAO

java.lang.Object
database.TransactionDAO
public class TransactionDAO extends Object
Data Access Object (DAO) class for handling database operations related to transactions.

This class provides methods for inserting transactions and their associated items into the database. All database operations are performed within a transaction context to ensure data integrity and consistency.

  • Method Details

    • addTransaction

      public int addTransaction(double amount, Integer customerId, int employeeId, List<Integer> itemIds, boolean isCard)
      Adds a new transaction record to the database, along with its associated item entries.

      This method performs the following operations:

      • Inserts a new record into the transactions table.
      • Retrieves the auto-generated transaction ID.
      • Inserts associated items into the transaction_items table.
      • Commits all changes as a single database transaction.
      If any error occurs during execution, the entire transaction is rolled back.
      Parameters:
      amount - the total amount of the transaction
      customerId - the ID of the customer making the purchase, or null if anonymous
      employeeId - the ID of the employee processing the transaction
      itemIds - a list of menu item IDs included in the transaction
      isCard - true if the transaction was made by card, false if by cash
      Returns:
      the generated transaction ID if successful, or -1 if the operation fails
